instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Topcase Question
threads.message: I had an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> come in for a keyboard replacement due to a bunch of keys breaking off, I've heard the horror stories of trying to replace the keyboard itself so I ordered a topcase from MobileSentrix that came complete with battery, keyboard, trackpad, and touchbar. Upon swapping everything over, the trackpad, keyboard, and touchbar don't work or light up at all. Swapped everything back to the original topcase and everything was working again. Are these parts serialized in any way, or did I just get a garbage topcase?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Topcase Question
threads.message:
All them are interchangeabale.
Connect and test each device one by one.
